riNHk9Tgrd_ucvEQpzb_Wg.text: Visited this bar after dinner. Had excellent service from our server Sarah. She recommended the " Old School" for the men and my friend ordered "the Daily" and I had a Goza beer. Loved the atmosphere and appreciated that our server asked our names, invited us back, and truly made the drinks with care. We are looking forward to going back there.

VBmOpdnHESc-ZmLfjXS82A.text: I love this place! They are located in the fourth ward uptown, right next to the Discovery Center. They did not skip out on the food or cocktails here! The White Bean & Quinoa Burger was delicious and the bloody mary was the best I've had in Charlotte. The mix is house-made and a bit spicy, but not overdone. They have a couple vegan and vegetarian options available, and plenty of good beers on tap (Deshutes Fresh Squeezed IPA and Birdsong Jalapeno for the win!) as well as some local favs in cans. The atmosphere is dim lit and very tavern-like, but I dig it. Our server was great and very attentive. I can't wait to visit the patio when we go back!

C_KRdts0efZ4SKlgINDJmQ.text: Not sure this place has figured out what it wants to be yet. Very cozy feel and the service was very good. However the food was a bit disappointing. The menu is short and trying to appeal to all kinds which means most will only find a few entrees if interest. I ended up getting the burger which was hearty but lacked any real distinctive taste. Also tried to order the fried pickles but was told they had just run out (on a Friday at 7:30). But upon further discussion found out that mean the chef didn't think they were good enough and was not serving them in this night, so I'll give kudos for that. Ended up being in and out in 30 minutes. I will be back but will also give it some time to see if the place evolves. Given some of the other places this group owns I think this will be a winner but needs to figure out what they want to be.

jAtls4CG428NuXQ886f8gA.text: Overall it was a solid experience. Service was above average and the food was good. Menu was plentiful with lots of options to share. We sat at the bar and the atmosphere was laid back. I'll be there again.

Gfx2KgUrZC-kTepRucGZKA.text: Hungry for Wings and The Daily didn't disappoint. Also enjoyed their Double Mac Burger. Staff friendly and attentive.

5Lu594pBSIO4dqrlliLdKg.text: The biscuits here are to die for and will make up for the slow service and mediocre other brunch dishes. They are the *best* biscuits I have ever had and the sweet honey butter that comes with them are the perfect accompaniment. I will be back for those biscuits.

AYYarP-8mpLVTUVq4NChDA.text: The clams may be the best thing on the menu. Warm drinks are great on a cold day. Great location, good drinks and friendly service. Great place to start your night.

ZbyeActYDh1qezt3F35wjA.text: Cozy place with good beer and the food is great as well. Recommend the white bean &. Quinoa burger.

cU7qCqYyQ8DMB_kqorr_2w.text: Great ribs and fantastic drinks. I was here for a catered party and the food, drinks, and service were all top notch. I look forward to coming back and trying their regular menu!

TQhZIAhZqa8H0txMjdvZdA.text: Had a delicious brunch this afternoon. Ordered the Southern Benedict and it was absolutely delicious. Who wouldn't love a biscuit topped with fried chicken, an over easy egg and sausage gravy?? They have a good beer selection and cocktail list. Will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

UAhpNz_PNXZihNr7c56-hw.text: Best and well structured menu in Uptown for every type of diet. The staff is great... Angel is my favorite person in the restaurant he is the best!!!

Qg9Hzui266RzuTsUFpAr8g.text: Outstanding food, great service, perfect location. The cheddar biscuits are so yummy they will make even the most hardcore paleo people fall off the wagon. Great beer selection, delicious cocktails. Biggest surprise was the brunch which rivals the best of Charleston. The Cherry on top is the service. Friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. Shout out to Christie! Thanks to Andrew Curry for giving Charlotte a great new place to eat, drink, and chill.

2UxTmPEjI_FwPw92Pn_Gcw.text: Thumbs up for this newcomer!  Cozy atmosphere and very professional staff.  Great selection of craft beers from east and west coasts.  The white bean and quinoa burger is made in-house and very tasty.

vRA81c8PDgOJ_4d3Y4iMUw.text: Really good wings, great Bloody Mary (though different so don't expect ZingZang), and awesome place.  Had a DJ playing music (New Years Day) but it wasn't overly loud nor house music so it was enjoyable.  Everyone that worked there was great and the inside is really comfortable.  Great spot for food and a few drinks.  Only things to consider is that its not a spot for game-watching (TVs are small and few) and the lighting is on the very dim-side, could use turning up a bit.  All in all really enjoyed it though.

osj17Z3LbNac6vba4gA-PQ.text: Brand new bar right across from the discovery place in uptown. Super cozy interior, great outdoor space, friendly staff. Their chicken wings were awesome and just the right amount of heat. The Carmel corn was also yummy. My friend had beef jerky and the clams with cheddar biscuits, she was full and happy. Their cocktail list looked interesting, though I stuck to rose,I'll have to come back to try some!

sF0KzWRSWzucOmbn05pw7w.text: Good night; I thought I was simply out with my friends, having a good time and enjoying an evening of debauchery(2 beers). Until a bunch of joyless lightless moths found out that there were humans enjoying the night at a mediocre bar with modest drinks and less than memorable drink service. I thought this place was a spot worthy of have a night cap on the way home, while at a real watering hole. Now I know that this place is actually worth less than a place to scrape the mud off of my boots nor does it had the staff to wish me a good evening  on a otherwise flawless night. Truly, your place is slightly more respectable than the pig-stile that I was raised in.  Good evening,  Your friending LSU HILLBILLY.

fO4Z0kaBTdzjLAVa9vQH2A.text: This place is awesome!  Great food and a great place to watch our team play football. Friendly staff and fresh tasty food keep us coming back.  Beef jerky for snacks, burgers and roasted chicken club are delicious as is their chop salad- bright, fresh and tasty.  Will continue to darken their door!

JZrErduxX-WUPosk698u6A.text: Love this new place, definitely will be my go to spot for a drink. Their Bloody Mary is by far, the best one that I've had!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

EQPgCNxaZjFC4mRQsf120A.text: Great restaurant and bar! The patio is amazing when it's nice out and the food and drinks are outstanding. Insider tip, the brunch is delicious and only on the weekends (I had the Southern Benedict and my wife had the breakfast biscuit). The bloody's are also fantastic. It's a little dim inside, but there are plenty of TVs for sports and is a great spot for drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

IKNi3bPui_0L8vdx95svug.text: What a great new addition to the dining / imbibing options in Uptown Charlotte! Andrew & Moe aren't very attractive to look at but they sure do know how to run a great show here .. the food is superb & they know how to pour a Guinness in proper fashion!  Cheers!!

N-gM5vnDlwrqh-3e4pDyKw.text: Great customer service and there bloody Mary's are freakin' terrific. I cannot wait for the next opportunity to got back to this place.

JSy8bhbNdjxAWdYGMx6vjw.text: A pretty good place; excellent music choices and the staff is friendly and welcoming; the ambiance is very nice and cozy;the food is ok and the beef jerky is awesome!

RcyHuDAL42Cx_K_qMCgp0g.text: First time here today. Had chicken club, a salad and southern eggs Benedict with the meat and cheese to start. Tried the cure, a twist on Bloody Mary. Not a fan of the cure but the food was fantastic and the atmosphere is terrific. Sat on the heated patio and was toasty warm but chilly outside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

YoJnAX8-wWkzzPCaz6z0UQ.text: Nice place! Their patio is my favorite. I love their cheddar biscuits and the quinoa burger! Good drinks and lovely staff!

UetpS7Uw9ttkNtb5oNsLhw.text: Pros: The wait staff are super nice and laid back.  The beer selection is really extensive, they have cool signature cocktails, but they are all on the sweet side so be prepared for that They allow dogs on the outside patio which now has seats too, so that's been great for us to stop by for a drink or snack while out walking our pup!  Cons: The food can be inconsistent. In the past 5-6 times we have been here, the wings are a staple that we order. I'd say the last 2-3 times they came out in like 3 minutes after we put the order in, and they were cold and had a funky aftertaste? I dunno if maybe a lot of them get cooked at once and they just sit under a warmer? For what they charge for 6-7 wings and garnish, I'd gladly wait the few extra minutes to get them fresh fried?  Aside from the food though, this is definitely a place where you could walk in during the day, have drinks and hang out, and not even realize it's already the evening. Great dive bar vibe, I'd recommend checking it out if you live in the area.

V1Q_-nj0NGbCPWWjtvhnZQ.text: LOVE THIS PLACE SO MUCH! I usually don't do reviews but this place is a hidden gem in Charlotte. Starting from the ambience to the bartenders, everything is on spot! Highly recommend trying out this place, and most importantly highly recommend asking for Papa my favorite bartender. He is amazing at what he does!

TyZTID1y7zDJnuAvlt1hXg.text: I went here on NBA All Star weekend and we knew that most places wold be busy. We were seated ridgt away, but thing went downhill right away. I was there with  my daughter and five grandkids. It took 35 after seating to get out drinks. There were a lot of people, but it was not packed. Four of our six meals were brought out almost an hour of being seated. But all four were wrong. All were taken back, but even then all of redos were wrong as we checked on them. The manager apologized and took two of the meals off our bill but it was not enough  to compensate for all the headache. It may have been a bad server oe just a bad day for the rest, I will never recommend this resturant.  There are just to many good restaurants out there to accept this service.

IaNYRGUVl7DqKTd1v87yVA.text: My daughter brought us here for Brunch on Father's Day... what a blast. Not only did they have great pub food (I enjoyed both the  in house made beef jerky and tender fall off the bone confit pork ribs with blueberry BBQ sauce) yum...... nice selection of beers (to wash it all down) & tasty cocktails there after but there was more.......something I have not seen b4 but definitely added an enjoyable twist for Father's Day........ they had a drawing of prizes 4 the dad's. I pulled a $20 grift card to OMB.....niceI'll be back.....

Itdf8RphGBmRrjh8XzUjqA.text: We held a company event at The Daily and reserved the outside patio area. Andrew, the catering manager, was incredible to work with, especially since I was planning this from the west coast. He was great with helping me plan our menu and suggested a themed drink to make our event fun. On the day of, the staff was super attentive and so friendly. They were right there to refill our drinks while remaining unobtrusive, which was important for this networking meeting.  The atmosphere of the bar is great and the food is delicious. Can't recommend it enough. Thanks to Andrew and his staff for a great event.

YR1BENbOvq9GcHAibMUEXQ.text: GO TO The Daily!!! This is our new favorite spot in uptown. We went for brunch and the food was delicious! A must try is the white cheddar biscuits starter. The lightest, fluffiest biscuits I've had in a long time. The white cheddar flavor was incredible and perfect. Other than the food being amazing, the service was outstanding, prices were great and much better than most places we've been and the atmosphere can't be beat. Plenty of seating inside and out. The playlist was also on point. Everything from Sam Cooke to Fleetwood Mac. They also validate parking for the 5/3 parking garage around the corner on 6th so there's no reason not to go!

ZKupP2cNbRtGSUmP2PUhOA.text: The owners bring the best ribs in charlotte to the daily.   This corner needed a place with this type of ownership and great service.

6cPQGbJiZnApf4mfcc2oHw.text: Waited at the bar for a good 10 minutes without anyone approaching me. Then two guys come in and sit next to me and immediately get greeted and get their drink orders taken. I literally had to wave to the bartender to get his attention and ask for a menu. He didn't apologize or seem to care to tend to me. Didn't ask if he could get me a drink, just handed me a menu and walked away. I was so appalled I got up and walked out. Would never step foot in this establishment again. Horrible customer service. Blows me away how unattentive and careless the bartender was especially since he literally makes money off tips. My biggest pet peeve is a server or bartender with a bad attitude or horrible customer service skills since we the customers are the ones giving them money which they live off!

mczfJ2KUKjqGcIOwDlykUQ.text: Great food, excellent beer selection and the bar staff are friendly and attentive. We came in for drinks and stayed at the bar to eat. Their beef jerky is different and surprisingly fulfilling as a snack: a combo of sweet, spicy and salty, tender and shaped like bacon strips and twists. For the meal my husband had the crab and bacon gnocchi which got a huge thumbs up from him. I had the meat and cheese platter which is listed as a shared appetizer but was perfect for my Keto diet. All in all a fine experience at a tavern with a homey neighborhood vibe. We'll be back.

6VmgajRf-O5gy8MLqeOM9A.text: The best chicken pot pie this side of the Mississippi!!!!!!! Also the cheddar biscuits are out of this world

--ExYqijRm_rO-OBIx5IyQ.text: Great vibe inside, nice porch on outside. We came for Sunday brunch. Food was delicious and service was fast and friendly. We had the Southern biscuit and chicken club - so good!

bnNcbWiAs0OJNhliPJCXog.text: My friend  I came here for an early lunch. Place wasn't crowded and was sat immediately. Our waiter came to take our drink order and was very knowledgeable about their beer selection. I was able to sample a couple beers which was great because I hated them both lol but all in all I found a beer that I liked. My friend ordered the Chicken Club and I had their Daily Mail Burger. LET ME SAY THIS WAS HANDS DOWN THE BEST BURGER I'VE EVER HAD! My friend said that her chicken club was absolutely delicious. The cost of a sweet tea, beer, and 2 entrees ran me about $30. With tip you're looking around $35-$37. I wish they were a little faster with coming out with the food, but it was worth the wait. Next time we are in town we will definitely stop by. Oh and they Validate parking! Between 10a

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

T-vdaZf_-BzccYgSJLmJTA.text: To the team, to PaPa! Thank you for making every visit feel special.  Your food is incredible and your hugs and handshakes forever welcoming

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

CCI0533pgtk2nwTGvIKrjQ.text: We finally got a chance to check this place out on a Thursday night for dinner.  The interior is very cozy and the outdoor patio is super cute!  I had the G Man vodka lime drink and it was delicious and refreshing.  My husband had the Bulleit cocktail and said it was great.  We had some fried pickles to start which were crispy and tasty.  He had the pot pie for dinner and loved it while I had the burger with shoestring fried and it was all wonderful.  Andrew was super friendly, as always.  We will definitely be going back to try some of the other foods and check out the fri/sat night DJs!  Great new gem uptown.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

-xGHbQjk4lCjWkeAijZCfg.text: The Daily was great!! I called ahead for an 8 PM table for 5 on a Friday and they held a table for us no problem on the patio.  Landon was a great server, the food came out quickly, the beer and cocktail selection (we didn't try any wines) was great and their vegetarian options were fantastic. They do a white bean burger and instead of serving it with fries, they automatically serve it with a side of veggies (carrots and cauliflower) because the fries are cooked in animal fat. The burger was great and the consideration of vegetarians was very thoughtful. We'll definitely be back next time we are uptown!

SdpwLrGu4SMdU33wVRptFw.text: Stopped in during the Friends of Fourth Ward Garden Tour as they were giving out free nibbles. They also had discounted cocktails-oh my! The location was delightful and I'm excited for the menu. Honestly, I had assumed it was all just beer and wasn't planning on giving it another thought. But when I saw the menu and the patio space... well, let's just say that I'm planning on checking out all of the food items at this point.

svnocrKT0NYOMlKloQdE-g.text: It never gets old! I love this spot. The service and food is consistently amazing. I can't for the life of me remember our bartenders name, but he was so much fun and hospitable! He offered great beer suggestions, and got us a complimentary olives and baguette since they were out of fried pickles. We had the Pot Pie (we always do) and it was delicious as usual. So good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Pot Pie (AMAZING!!!)
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clams...soooo good!

M1wuIEGaRXb5HMwfcINkKQ.text: A fun place with a nice menu. A huge beer offering and some great drinks as well. Very creative menu and reasonably priced. Highly recommended, a nice neighborhood spot!

W4qLTNvnzWExAUuZre4JIw.text: Walked in were greeted with a smile :-) atmosphere is nice and cute server was great! But we waited on our food for 42 minutes. Kitchen definitely needed to speed it up considering we were the only guests . Paid 30$ for a meal I truly didn't like southern Benedict..but I took it home for my dog:-) hopefully he likes it

N1yYPTdhIv9SaAQ27Dn2hQ.text: It was my first time trying this place. I ordered through Postmates and although they got my order correct, the fries weren't fresh and the vegetables didn't look too appetizing. The veggie burger was pretty good though.

wigY83hlaHglStuhaTaSOQ.text: Mama Bear left the cubs back in Cali and headed to North Carolina with my aunt to visit some family. On one of our ventures out, we ended up at The Daily. One of the things that drew me in was the variety in the menu-a nice beer list, cocktails and wine (I don't like being pigeon-holed in terms of my liquor, especially if I'm not craving anything in particular). Walking in, the place is dark and cool (the AC was on blast which was quite refreshing since it was a warm day). It was not very crowded so we were able to sit in a nice booth inside (although there is also seating outside). So, what's good?  Try both of the wings (hot and BBQ-they are delicious, especially if you need something to soak up those beers or cocktails). Try the fried pickles (extra crispy dipped in ranch is pretty cool). Being from the west coast, trying appetizers like fried pickles is a nicety. I also had a salad with strawberries, walnuts, etc. and it was so good. In terms of drinks, my aunt ordered a chocolate cake shot (she threw back three in a row which tells me that they were probably really good!). The Mexican Mocha (a hot cocktail) was quite bitter (if you're looking for sweet, this is not the hot cocktail for you). You can really taste the liquor though, so if you're in to strong, bitter, hot cocktails, this is for you (not so much me...). I ended up ordering a cider which was refreshing on a warm June day in Charlotte and made up for my sweet tooth by ordering the Chocolate Pot for dessert. The cocktails are around $12, but they run daily specials during Happy Hour, so don't forget to ask about it.   Nice vibe, good selection of beverages and appetizers and great service. If you are in Charlotte, check them out.   Tip: there is a parking structure right next to the bar (cost: $3 for first 20 minutes and $3 for each additional 20 minutes, but The Daily does not validate).

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

AAZ0S0-sQve3bdphZyv7Dg.text: Talk about a place that makes you feel discriminated. Only table with more than 3 people and the manager goes to take an order with an attitude, then he sends someone to kick us out because we got a table and were laughing. Terrible manager ... if a manager doesn't know how to treat his customers then don't own a business. All other employees were nice to us and wanted to make sure we left on good terms, but the manager ruined it all. I would not go back there because of this man. I felt discriminated and I don't tolerate that.

wtByuf-Zm07CoHSTGnJsQg.text: Picked this place because of the Yelp reviews and was not disappointed.  Highly recommend the Roasted Chicken Club.  Also, be sure and order some of their blue cheese to dip your sandwhich and fries in.  Hot wings are also legit!!!   Great atmosphere and amazing food.  We will definitely be back when in the Charlotte area.

aglNKv4292CgOC53sEwXeg.text: Great food, excellent beer selection and the bar staff are friendly and attentive. We came in for drinks and stayed at the bar to eat. Their beef jerky is different and surprisingly fulfilling as a snack: a combo of sweet, spicy and salty, tender and shaped like bacon strips and twists. For the meal my husband had the crab and bacon gnocchi which got a huge thumbs up from him. I had the meat and cheese platter which is listed as a shared appetizer but was perfect for my Keto diet. All in all a fine experience at a tavern with a homey neighborhood vibe. We'll be back.

2ylsN9Lwj1vO4ElXemUf-g.text: Had a great experience after a Sunday show!  A lot of eating establishments are closed on Sunday... no the Daily!  Had the pickled Quail eggs and an appetizer and they were great. Got the chicken pot pie, meat and cheese plate and the steak. Shared all three and could not asked for more. Great beer selection on draft as well!  As a side note, we commented on how great the fries looked... our servers brought a small bowl for us to enjoy and they were great!  Great service!!  We will revisit again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

8Z9JUXiB0wL_nFlQnNfOWw.text: We waited for someone to seat us. 3 bartenders saw us but ignored us so we just sat down and kept waiting. Still no service. So we left. Mediocrity at its finest

RbM7KjzpbyXDNzBzJ4pHlw.text: I love this place. Best burger in Charlotte. Fries are amazing. All the food it's honestly so good. I've had almost everything on the menu. They have a great beer and cocktail list too. Wait staff and bartenders are always super friendly. GREAT spot in 4th Ward!!!

9ydbcUQahnkygEZM9qs6nw.text: Great experience for dinner and drinks. Want to thank Gus and Christie for such a great experience

YbDDTW_-EZaUgxFpvrsPgg.text: Great neighborhood spot. Went for Sunday Football, and they had all of the NFL games. Wings were amazing, great beer selection & our bartender Shelby was nice, knowledgable and attentive. Definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

GydErkIZUdWOrU17510GHw.text: This bar/restaurant has Character.  Old charm with some cool modern characteristics.  I got the steak which was cooked perfectly and had amazing flavors. Also had the pickled eggs that were yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pickled egg
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

tjSbTNfwQq1lg1Ot31TEug.text: What an awesome first experience at this place! First- excellent and friendly bartenders (Amber and Papa). The interior is perfect- great long Bar and then high tables all around (this is key). Candles everywhere. Had a killer chicken pot pie. Nice draft beer selection. Music that was playing was a great selection AND played at a proper volume. Very cozy place with some cool patio options as well. Tvs here and there but doesn't overwhelm the intended atmosphere. Really well done- I go out all the time at a wide variety of bars and restaurants. And after talking with the owner I can tell why this place gets it--it all starts with good management. Nice job Andrew! Their "#settlein" is perfect!

SYQvvKMMCKVjPYDi3tLv9w.text: What a charming little place.  Our server, Christi,  was absolutely fabulous.  Not being from Charlotte we were still finding our way around town.  She was knowledgeable about the area and took the time to chat with us (who does that?)  The charcuterie was just the right amount for two and the mimosa's were delightful.  We enjoyed the fried pickles as an appetizer. Yum! The tavern does have an inhouse dj which you can hear from the patio.  This is a sports bar so there is a good view of a tv screen from just about any table. We found this place charming and if we ever find ourselves back in Charlotte we will most definitely spend some time here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charcuterie
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Pickles
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. $5 mimosas during brunch

HDdR9mSpfnXEAlaVGjIyWw.text: Two highlights of this place:  The patio area is very cute The buttermilk ranch served with the fried pickles   Our server was very sweet but not the most knowledgable. I got a salad which was very short on the amount of bacon.... and very heavy in the dressing. I may have just ordered wrong (and maybe a little boring).  Overall though it was a fine experience... I would go back. The fried pickles were quite yummy.

ZrTjl-dALRHmEj7pxHFbbQ.text: We were looking for a nice restaurant in Uptown with a good range of food options and saw this place had a lot of good reviews so we gave it a try. We sat out on their side patio which wasn't necessarily super open but you still got a breeze. It was more like a side room with some open windows. They have a ton of TVs which definitely makes it a nice place to watch a game but didn't have a sports bar feel which I really liked. We started with their fried pickles which luckily did not go in the same fryer as their fries. Their fries are cooked in fat so not vegetarian friendly. The pickles were delicious. We were starving so my friend and I easily polished them off. We each got a smaller entree. She got their Cobb salad and I got the veggie bowl. The veggie bowl was great! The grain was farro which is super filling and satisfying and there was a great representation of different vegetables. Our server was super helpful and our food revived us. I wish they had more vegetarian options as I would probably have to keep ordering the same meal but all around great spot for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. The veggie bowl! Highly recommend.

jmYAdiFfVTduO1Zr6F5yEQ.text: Three stars is about all I can do for The Daily Tavern for now.    The restaurant is clean, staff members friendly. The decor is characteristic of a speak easy but with a rustic tavern spin. There is plenty of seating, but it was not that busy during a Saturday morning brunch.   The pro of brunch here is definitely the mimosa bar. That was fabulous. You get the glass of prosecco and you go to the mimosa bar to choose your juice. They have orange, pear, peach, etc. There are is a selection of fresh fruit to jazz it up as well. We visited the mimosa bar a couple of times this brunch.   The negative was the extremely limited options for a vegan. I ended up getting the avocado toast with no egg and bacon. Which was one slice of toast with avocado spread on it. I would like to see some additional options to spice brunch up for a vegan. That's just a personal preference leading me to suggest.   Staff was overall friendly and tentative. As my friends and I had been chatting and sitting around with mimosas, a server came up to tell us they were putting a reserved group where we were. She offered to seat us elsewhere in the restaurant. This was not unheard of since we had been there a while catching up. But we were paying customers and I would just like the offer to move us be a statement not a question that comes after saying a new group would be there within moments. She did do her best to be polite, and we were definitely understanding and recognized she did her best with that situation.    I am sure we will return for another brunch since we all live near, but I would hope to see some added menu items for alternative diets soon!

gEJOpHQqMoAs8RMQLhaO8w.text: If you want to eat a meal here, do not order the delicious cheddar biscuits first.  Each one weighs about 6-7 lbs and comes with honey butter.  Once you start eating them, you won't have room for much else.    I would recommend starting with the beef jerky, though.  It's a great way to enjoy a snack while you sip on a cocktail. The beef jerky and the white cheddar biscuits were the highlight for me.    The cocktails and wings were fine, but I would come back here for the beef jerky and biscuits, with a couple of drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken wings
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rebel Rebel with some beef jerky

AxgdQ3wLsOwVn_ofuBMSaw.text: An absolute gem in Uptown. My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this restaurant after a fairly long evening of drinking and walking and looking for a place open serving food and not being treated like late-night annoyances. We were happy from start to finish. We ordered simply a cheese and charcuterie plate and chicken wings. Hands down the best we've ever had. Food tastes homemade but also unique. Wonderful service from Mary. Sweet, polite and efficient. We can't wait to go back.

ay4cVcBznBiZbBcRatSl5Q.text: We loved this place. I was in town for the ACC tournament and had dinner with my daughter. The waitress recommended the wings and they did not disappoint. They were crispy with great flavor. My daughter got the Daily Dog and I got the chicken club. Both were fantastic. I had the chocolate pot for dessert. It was also tasty. This place has a great atmosphere as well. We sat outside and enjoyed the evening.

YRnoyqeBS9NHWXnux70RfA.text: If you are looking for a neighborhood bar feel this is the place for you. Always reminds me of "how I met your mother" bar. It has a chill vibe where you can bring your friends to hang for the night.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great selection.

T7fFQfapBUL3GpxtkepHhQ.text: Andrew helped me to set up this wonderful outing/happy hour for my colleagues after a long day of helping to set up Uptown Charlotte for the Pride Parade.  We had apps, lots of cold, frosty drinks, a shady place to rest, and a wonderful and attentive server who made us feel right at home!  Thank you so much for welcoming a bunch of tired, smelly workers!!  We LOVED the food and drinks, the atmosphere was relaxed and lovely, and we WILL be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

k1chD5MeraAJvvXDcLuFDw.text: This place is so good! What a great bar to end the night at. I had drunken clams and the wings while sitting at the bar. Both excellent, I had to ask for more bread for the juice the clams were in (the best part obviously). The bartenders were all extremely friendly and the beer selection was good. A friend had a signature drink and said it was done really well (can't remember it). This seems like a local spot that's been there forever, even though it hasn't. Definitely had a Cheers vibe in a good way.

7fscvocV86tKbxgh4jA7ow.text: This place is awesome. The renovations they did before opening make it a MAJOR upgrade over the old Stool Pigeons/Dillengers/whatever else it used to be. The extra outside area (there are two outside areas now) is an upgrade on two fronts:  obviously sitting outside is cool but it also improved the interior. The place doesn't seem so expansive and dead inside now. It's a great neighborhood bar.   Oh and if you're hungry get the chicken pot pie. It's phenomenal.

LNhl4x5Wx6Vyi5j024N15w.text: Absolutely love the atmosphere here. The bartenders are so attentive and friendly (especially Papa!). The wings are incredible. We tried the drunken clams on our last visit and they tasted so fresh. Would definitely order again. We've also gotten the Daily Mac burger and it's perfectly cooked every time. I've never had a bad thing here.

15tHvKBBYcHkfLzqzJ9DJA.text: The daily tavern is a great brunch spot! The food was delicious and and the ambience was very cool and trendy. I highly recommend the southern fried chicken biscuit. The chicken was very moist and flavorful and was topped with  sausage gravy. The servers were also very friendly and personable. The only downside is the brunch menu is a little limited and if you are looking for your typical brunch fare you won't find it here. But the food they do offer is great. So if you are willing to step out from the usual eggs and bacon you won't be disappointed. Just make sure you get the biscuits

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

j3Xo7rY4AHdxeOS9qYhdTw.text: Went with my 3 other friends.. we all got something different and it was soo good! Every dish.. the chicken club isn't just a club! Great food

raO4_IhGQcNhN3-foCliHg.text: Love the Daily- especially for brunch with my peeps and dog. The bamboo patio is a great dining spot! Intimate and cool, with TVs too. Music was upbeat and chill.  Everyone is super friendly and helpful, seems like they really like their jobs which is nice. Ask for Angel if you want a super experience- he's a great guy.  Food was great - Southern Benedict (Cheddar biscuit, fried chicken, over easy egg, sausage gravy) and The Daily Mac (house-ground double burger, jack cheese, and awesome skinny fries).

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch Menu - Friday-Sunday. Yum!

J7L3k2QdXKBI3W6PlCFLzw.text: Delicious and a great vibe. Came to Charlotte for the weekend and stopped in for brunch with my bachelorette party crew. We all ordered different things, but one thing that was consistent across the whole group was how wonderful our food was. Mimosa bar was cool. I had the Benedict and holy smokes it was good. I would come back to Charlotte just to eat here. 5 stars.

UMq-myH01MhE8ZQ_GJa1Bw.text: Great little spot in uptown for lunch or a casual dinner.  They have a great drink selection and beers on tap.  And their cocktails are delicious.  Food was also pretty good. I had the special of a bison burger and fries. Love the thin shoe string fries they serve there.  The rest of the table enjoyed their food as well.  Only downside was that one of my friends waited quite awhile on her drink, otherwise a great experience!

UB5i5CgyAKGxJu5atai_1g.text: Despite a few negatives, i absolutely love this place!  Negatives:  Not a place to watch sports. TVs are tiny. My computer monitor at work is bigger than the TV at the bar. There are others that  are a little bigger. Okay for the casual sports fan.   Really loud if you are over 37 and four months. Acoustics issue i think. Sometimes thI bartender can't hearMusic is great though.   Wings - one sauce to rule them all? It is a good sauce but it tries to be spicy, zesty and yummy.  I can pull that off but the sauce doesn't. Give me a few choices dammit!  Everything else is great. Bartenders are one of the best crews in Uptown which says a lot. Collectively they are smart, professional, knowledgeable, funny and hot.   Strong food options. Really enjoyed the pot pie, gnocchi, oysters and chopped salad over the course of several visits.   Beer selection is excellent and includes many locals. Only tried one of their cocktails. It was good but too sweet for me.   Love The Daily!  So this place has been open for a while since my first review.  We live one block away and happy to say we still give five stars.   We still come for the drinks and the food. More often than not, we order the pot pie and the wings. The biscuit are to die for. Their strawberry jam on a biscuit is heaven. We also occasionally enjoy Brunch.   The bartender staff has changed but they are in great hands with Papa. Living in uptown, you get to know the best bartenders/servers. There are some great people everywhere but I can say without pause that  none of them are nicer and more customer service focused than Papa. He always remembers us and the second we walk through the door, he is greeting us. There is no one who treats their customers better.   If you want to go where the locals go for great food and great service, The Daily is that place.

QC9xXgAZlSqLY-lL1aQd9Q.text: We came for brunch and had a great time! Whether you sit inside or outside, they have a great atmosphere and TVs. We got avocado toast, breakfast sandwich and white bean and quinoa burger. We really enjoyed sitting outside and watching the World Cup!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

KJgi3AUUsu8bqmfU9h98JA.text: My husband and I came across this gem when we were at a hotel a few blocks away. I always find that many restaurants in uptown Charlotte are either too busy or too upscale for what I'm usually looking for, but the Daily Tavern really hit the spot! The atmosphere is very cozy, even though there is lots of room for seating. They also have quite a few TVs if you're looking for a game!  We shared the olives and bread while deciding because everything sounded so delicious. I ended up ordering the crab and bacon gnocchi, which was honestly one of the best soups I have ever had. You can't go wrong with gnocchi, and theirs is amazing! My husband had the roasted chicken club, which looked great as well.  We will definitely be returning to try more next time we're in town. That pot pie (& burger with mac and cheese) won't eat itself!

U6FkqxlNMKRt6KM0t2D20w.text: I came here last night for a snack & drink with my friend prior to attending a concert.   We really enjoyed it! It's definitely got that "tavern feel." They play great music and the service was impeccable! Joe was outstanding. Personable and friendly!   We each had a drink and shared an order of the wings. My only complaint is that there were only 7. Why not 8 or 10, or an even number in general? A little odd to me, no pun intended. However, these were absolutely delicious! Homemade hot sauce and a smoky & spicy flavor.   I can't wait to come back to try more menu items!

lEizb0QXICX7pxE7MOeI1Q.text: I am a fan!   I came here last Sunday for brunch around 11:45 am, and luckily the restaurant was pretty empty that we were seated right away. We opted to sit outside since it was really warm outside, and it was a perfect decision (I ALWAYS get cold inside places).   Anyways, I ordered the French Toast minus bacon, and my bf ordered southern benedict. I loved the french toast especially because the fruit and french toast pair so perfectly. I wasn't a fan of the apples since I don't like apples, but I still ate them.   The only thing I have to complain about is the mimosa that I ordered. First off, I don't understand why there is a $1 charge to change the juice. I don't like OJ in my mimosa, I like other juices like grapefruit, strawberry, peach mango, or literally any other juice. Our waitress mentioned how there was a mimosa bar (which was way more expensive), but I didn't want to do that because I literally just wanted one or two if I really liked it. I asked for a Mango Mimosa knowing there would be an added charge to it, and then the waitress told me if I wanted another non-standard mimosa, she would charge me for the mimosa bar. So dumb. To my luck, the champagne that they use was WAYYYY too bubbly for me, and I didn't even enjoy it enough to order another one.   I would recommend for food though!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

xZZGxZvUb_lGw4OCcgPwRQ.text: Outstanding SERVICE!!! This was our first time stumbling upon this place. I know this place has been several different bars in past 10 years but I'm really hoping this one sticks around.  I love the vintage vibes of the place very cool.  The two bartenders Angel and Papa I think their names were. They went above and beyond to make us have a great experience!  Hats off to them, we will definitely be back because of that!!! Would love to try their food next time for sure, menu looked appealing...LOVED THE HOMEMADE BEEF JERKY!!!!!

RtMOCxy3qT3LMUMBkKpfnA.text: The menu is not for everyone. I personally liked my buffalo chicken sandwich but it's not like the buffalo chicken up north. The staff was friendly but I did not appreciate my ID being checked so aggressively. The bar tender started bending it and looking at it under the light for 3 whole minutes. My ID is real and I've never had that happen since I turned 21. They also ID'd me at the door so I found this unnecessary.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

hyH2dSRHtZ8ZE4rQ5kk-Rg.text: Great food, fantastic atmosphere, and an amazing staff. So basically, it's what you would expect from the Best Bars Group (the same people behind Dandelion, Workman's Friend, Tyber Creek, Connolly's).  I think I've tried pretty much the entire menu by now. I love the beef jerky as a snack. The crab & bacon gnocchi is probably my favorite entree. Pot pie and the Butcher's Cut are both delicious. Pro tip on the Roasted Chicken Club: ask for it as a regular sandwich. You don't need that extra piece of bread in the middle. And as Isaiah W noted, it comes with a mountain of shoestring like fries. Plenty to share. My latest visit, our server recommended the Drunken Clams as a shareable starter for the table. She nailed it with that, such an underrated hidden gem of the menu. Make sure you dip that bread into the broth. So yum.   Speaking of our server from last night, shout out to Lexie! Such a delight. I have never had a bad experience here, the service is always top notch.   Drink-wise, I love all their warm bevvies during the cold months. The Cold Winter and Hot Apple Jerry are my two favs. Don't worry, they have PBR and Coors Banquet as well.  Parking: The Daily now validates for the Fifth Third deck.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pot pie

SbZO9hQ1qVvG3_HRQrtIxw.text: My colleague-friends and I enjoyed an incredible late night meal at The Daily Tavern last night. First off, the restaurant is really cool; it's long and narrow inside and has an adjoining covered patio area which is where we decided to sit. There are lots of TVs both inside and out, which was great for catching up on some sports.   We knew we were in great hands with our server, Lexi (hopefully I'm spelling that correctly!). She offered great suggestions and was on top of every drink refill or other need throughout our visit. We started with fried pickles and clams, both perfect for sharing. The fried pickles were plentiful and served in a basket with a side of ranch for dipping. The clams were in a delicious beer broth with crumbled sausage. Sliced baguette was served on the side - perfect for dipping.   There were so many great choices on the menu, it was hard to decide. I opted for the butcher's cut, a sliced skirt steak which was tender and super flavorful. It was served with garlic mash and asparagus. It was fantastic! Everyone else at the table enjoyed their meals as well.   As we were preparing to leave, Lexi asked if anyone wanted to take a soft drink to go. I'm staying in a hotel so this kind gesture was greatly appreciated and I happily took her up on some club soda.   I'm so impressed by Charlotte's dining scene and The Daily Tavern is a restaurant I'd love to visit again next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Butcher&#39;s cut

NCubcnW-5ctf8vIhY8WH5w.text: This is my second time visiting Charlotte, and my second time checking out The Daily Tavern. Last time we just popped in for a few drinks and gave their delicious picklebacks a shot (pun intended).   This time we were very very hungry so decided to do a couple of shareable starters and then each ordered an item from the main dishes section. The Drunken Oysters and Fried Pickles to start were incredible and so so tasty. Everyone at the table was blown away and they should definitely be on list if you have interest in Oysters or Pickles.   My main dish I went with the chicken club and oh my goodness it was one of the best sandwiches I've had. It also came out with a mountain full of string fries and they were great as well! I would definitely tell anyone nearby to give them a shot. The staff is great and our server Lexi was extremely friendly, diligent and helpful. Thanks again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States

51IAZgQJiS15rfz0SJIy6A.text: Tried out The Daily Tavern after hanging out in Uptown with the Mrs. and working up an appetite. It was later in the evening maybe 9pm or so and when we first arrived we were probably 2 of 15 people here which after navigating the crowds to get here we didn't  mind.  Eventually the crowd picked up and the staff kicked into high gear which was really cool to watch. I couldn't resist getting the beef jerky as a snack. It was very tender, but just a little too salty for my personal preference.  I would order it again and bank on the idea that maybe I just had a salty batch.   The rest of our food was on par with what you'd expect from ine if the better bars in CLT.   The drinks were tasty and made with flare.   Definitely a place I'd go to again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Late meal

bvQw9GvXgbBdEZGlt_eB4A.text: Great draft beer selection. We sat at the bar and were treated to very good service. Our beer wasn't even empty when they were bringing us a new one. The cheese biscuits with butter and pepper jelly were amazing. I had the veggie burger and my husband had the Daily dog and we both enjoyed every bite. We will be back.

QtjT3V38Mp6gBwrrY5by0w.text: The service here was great. We came in before the happy hour crowd made it in, but once they did, this place was busy. Despite the chaos, our server was super attentive and pleasant.   I highly recommend the local creamy pale ale on draft, it was a new one for me and delicious. The food menu is short, but I decided to give the fried pickles a shot. The serving size was generous and taste was perfection. The short ribs were a miss for me though. I was excited to try the interesting blueberry barbecue combo flavor, but it was odd. The slaw, however, was good and exactly the tangy flavor I expected from NC. You also can't go wrong with the shoestring fries. They too were cooked to crispy warm perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blueberry barbecue short ribs with slaw and shoestring fries

h8yy2EYtow0qP6cJmVt2Nw.text: Stopped into The Daily after seeing Hamilton at the Belk Theatre in Uptown Charlotte. It is only a few blocks away and made for an easy walk. It was a Sunday and much to my surprise was operating more as a night club rather than a restaurant (this was around 5pm). Because the music was so intense I opted to sit on the patio to enjoy a little post show meal.  The food is delicious. For an appetizer I had the muscles which were in an amazin rich and buttery broth. For dinner it was comfort food with the chicken pot pie. My portion had a good dose of protein and went down quickly! The biscuit topping was also so so delicious.   Brief menu, but I liked that. Great beer and drink list. Just a little bit of a funny atmosphere. You wouldn't post up here for a football game with Club Daily in the background. Not sure if it's like that ever Sunday. I would definitely try it again on another day.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Pot Pie, the ultimate comfort food
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Loved the covered outdoor patio

glb8sdUUL7_Bpq8e7qFNYg.text: Sunday Funday calls for two things---Great drink specials and food!   This was my first visit to "The Daily". I'm a fan of any establishment with purse hooks Under the bar. My friends and I arrived around 1:30PM (no wait time). I expected the bar to be packed, only a few tables were occupied. We choose to sit at the bar, the bartender was most informative. To our delight mimosas were special for $5! Yesss!!   I ordered the chicken wings--A perfect game day appetizer! I must say these were the best wings I've had in a long time. The flavor was amazing! Baked, fried, then tossed in a homemade hot sauce. The wings weren't too spicy, I liked the crisp texture. We also orders the White Cheddar biscuits with honey butter and peppered jelly. I didn't care for the peppered jelly much.   Overall, I look forward to visiting "The Daily" again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu Oct 2018
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Purse hooks under the bar!
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. The wings are delish!!

zFohffV34sbP1Al8jGTvJA.text: Ambience, Ambience and more Ambience!! It was very lovely. With a lot of exposed brick and amazing outside lighting, this place is for sure a looker. We attended for a birthday gathering and it was very nice. The waitress greeted us within 3 mins of joining our party and took our drink order. I ordered my fave cognac with a splash of ginger and lime. THE ONLY REASON they received this 3 is due to those drinks. They were very weak and tasted watered down. I assumed it was just that one so I ordered another one however this time a whiskey and spritzer. Still very weak! This really bummed me out as I love a good drink however THE PORK RIBS!!! OMG!! This were sooo delicious. They have a kind of grape/blueberry jam taste along with the tender meat that fell off the bone which was SUBLIME!!! TRUST ME, you will not be disappointed. However stick with a water or fountain drink.

3hUTDEyZfLGUJunL7VtjIw.text: The Daily Tavern is a great addition to the Uptown bar and restaurant scene. We popped in with a couple of friends last night to grab dinner and drinks before seeing a movie. I love the way the bar is decorated and laid out, but keep in mind that the space is very dark (only a couple of windows) so I personally think it's best for a bad weather day or sometime in the Fall or Winter when you're looking for some place warm. We grabbed four seats at the bar and the service was quick and friendly. They have a full bar, a large beer selection and about 10 different by the glass wine selections.   The food is awesome. We ordered the white cheddar biscuits to start...comes with butter and pepper jelly, so good. The chicken wings are also really good and the ranch is bomb. I love that they're served with pickled veggies. Everything else we ordered (burger with shoestring fries, fruit and nut salad with chicken, beef jerky) was really tasty and great portions.   There are TV's in the bar so I'm thinking this is a great spot for football season. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily Mac Burger
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fruit and nut salad add chicken
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side Garden Salad with red pepper vinaigrette

J2lGnq5BVm6sWq3Fi3Jh3g.text: I was really pleased with this place! I had passed by it a couple of times and finally made it over to check it out. They validate parking which is awesome and there is a deck attached to the restaurant. The decor is tavern style, but a nice and clean look.   It was moderately busy, but we were able to to still snag a table immediately. I tried a few drinks off the cocktail menu and each was good. As far as food, get the beef jerky to start. I know that may seem odd but it is amazing! I also tried the crab and bacon gnocchi featuring Lump crab, bacon, fresh corn, roasted tomatoes, parmesan. Definitely wasn't expecting to see gnocchi on the menu here so that was a nice surprise. I'm a fan.

hqHxXKklWqtsu_8IJsvm3w.text: The Daily Tavern is the most affordable bang for your buck brunch spots in all of Charlotte right now!   They have high quality tasting food without breaking your wallet and an atmosphere that works just right. We order beef jerky and wings to start for brunch as we sat out on the patio because it was a beautiful day outside. I wanted the devil eggs but they were out. Please judge me on all the meat I consumed via appetizers ... but it was so good!   The wings hands down are so balance in taste and I think The Daily Tavern is one of the top places to get wings at a none wing joint! They bake them first then fry them and add their sauce to it! Literally finger licking good but far better than KFC. The jerky was moist and had a great taste and kick to it as well.   The southern fried chicken biscuit is the way go here! It is a warm sausage gravy cooked just right and drizzled around a fluffy warm butter biscuit with the moist crunchy chicken and egg in the middle. The flavors sent my mouth into an overdrive of wonderfulness!   I highly recommend given it a try! We also got the French toast that comes with a fruit topping that was very good as well. I am definitely coming back here more often!!!   You will not be disappointed with the food or service. Hope to see you there too. Share the love if you agree.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerky
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings!!
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern fried chicken biscuit

gxBfxTsZF8yLdOXLW8Bktw.text: The Daily Tavern is one of my favorite places to go in uptown. The staff are always friendly and attentive and while every time I've been there it's been crowded I've never had a issue getting a bar stool or table. We've had dinner there a few times as well as brunch and the food has been delicious. My favorite menu item is the biscuits so I highly recommend trying them with the honey butter and pepper jelly. On our most recent visit we ordered the chicken club and pot pie both of which were filling and super flavorful. We will absolutely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pot pie
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken club with a side salad

A6emxVJ-qDP_iqjgksYeDg.text: What a cozy and welcoming place!  We wandered in here on a rainy Sunday afternoon for a drink and snack.  The bartender was super-friendly and helpful.  He offered several recommendations and made us feel like we were regulars.    I ordered the Daily Mary - a carrot juice bloody mary.  Honestly, I didn't love the carrot juice take on this drink - but that was just a bad order on my part.  We also ordered the meat & cheese tray - it was a generous serving of 2 cheeses, 2 meats, bread, pepper jelly, nuts and fruit.  I look forward to going back and hanging out again!

baJjoStHMtSJsQHibImpRA.text: What a great choice for a pre-Panthers game hangout. I mean, the location is far enough from the stadium that people don't really think about it as their first choice but close enough to be less than a 10 minute walk. AND between their drink specials and hearty comfort food, it's perfect.   Yesterday was The Lady and my second time coming here, and the food, like last time, did not disappoint. Although dark inside, there's a large variety of seating between the bar, high tops, tables, and the patio (covered in the winter, yessss). Their drink special of the day was $5 Jameson drinks, which for me, came in the form of a Jameson Ginger and an Irish Mule. Kudos to the bartender who came up with more ideas for me!   Food is elevated but nowhere near pretentious - like the crab gnocchi sitting right next to a hot dog. The Lady and I wanted to share some things so we got the meat and cheese board as well as the vegetable bowl (farro, brussel sprouts, other fall-y type things). Warning, portions are BIG here. They actually split our bowl into 2 separate bowls and it *still* looked like an entree at any other restaurant. Talk about bang for your buck.   Just as a tip, they now validate parking in the nearby garage, so you don't have to deal with uptown hell as much! I'm looking forward to coming back here again on Wednesday, when they have $5 Whiskey nights. Hello, Redbreast.

U75K4pANLGIAvPAt-KbAPg.text: This restaurant is terrific!  Every detail of this place is well thought out and done with style and care.  They bring you tap water in chilled green bottles that look like you're drinking Pellegrino.  Each wooden table is simply decorated with a pretty daisy and a mason jar candle.  Just the right blend of rustic and charming.  The bathrooms were immaculate!    They didn't have a lot of beers that we knew of to choose from, so the waiter suggested Palmetto.  They weren't to our liking.  But he was!  He provided terrific service.  He was fast, attentive and friendly.    The menu was rather small, and I didn't see a lot of items That weren't fried, but the prices were fair.  You get a lot of bang for your buck!  I would not hesitate to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pickle chips
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings and fries
Photo of The Daily Tavern - Charlotte, NC, United States. Palmetto light
